senses.de: To give or offer something for decision or judgment
senses.ex: I have to submit my essay by next week.

Tips.title: Deadline Context
Tips.description: Used when referring to deadlines or due dates for assignments and projects.
Tips.example: Students must submit their final projects by April 30th.

Tips.title: Process Step
Tips.description: Often indicates the next step in a series of actions, such as applications or processes.
Tips.example: After reviewing the guidelines, submit your application online.

Tips.title: Professional Tone
Tips.description: Conveys a formal, professional interaction, especially in written communication.
Tips.example: Please submit your report to the manager for approval.

senses.de: To accept or yield to a superior force or strength
senses.ex: The rebels had no choice but to submit to the government forces.

Tips.title: Power Dynamics
Tips.description: Indicates acknowledging someone else's control or authority, often reluctantly.
Tips.example: The employees had to submit to the new company policies.

Tips.title: Reluctant Acceptance
Tips.description: May indicate a lack of choice or the need to accept a situation begrudgingly.
Tips.example: After the debate, he was forced to submit to the opposing argument.

senses.ex: She submitted a new plan to solve the issue.

Tips.title: Idea Presentation
Tips.description: Suggests a more collaborative context where ideas are being offered for discussion.
Tips.example: Lara submitted her idea for the team's project theme.

Tips.title: Innovation Implication
Tips.description: Often associated with proposing new, innovative ideas or improvements.
Tips.example: The committee encouraged staff to submit any innovative solutions they had.

senses.de: To subject oneself, as in obedience or resignation, to the power and authority of a higher entity
senses.ex: You have to submit yourself to God's will.

Tips.title: Spiritual Obedience
Tips.description: Used in a spiritual context, often implying voluntary obedience to religious faith or teachings.
Tips.example: Devotees submit themselves to a life of meditation and prayer.

Tips.title: Moral Surrender
Tips.description: Can also imply a moral decision to follow a particular belief or code.
Tips.example: Through her charity work, she learned to submit to the needs of others.

senses.de: To present (a proposal, application, etc.) for the consideration or judgment of another
senses.ex: We submitted our evidence to the court.

Tips.title: Legal Procedures
Tips.description: Relates to formal submission of documents or evidence as part of legal processes.
Tips.example: The lawyer will submit the appeal to the higher court tomorrow.

Tips.title: Formal Documentation
Tips.description: Indicates the act of providing official, often written, materials as required.
Tips.example: Applicants must submit their passports along with the visa application form.

Accord.wordDefinition:
Accord means to reach an agreement with someone or something. This is usually when two or more people discuss and negotiate to come to a mutual understanding or make a compromise, so that each person can get what they want or need.

For example, two friends can accord to watch one movie that they both like at different times.

So, while accord implies a discussion and coming to an agreement, submit usually implies following rules or regulations without questioning them.

Comply.wordDefinition:
Comply means to obey or follow a rule, law or request. It implies that a person is willingly following the given order.

However, if a teacher asks a student to comply with the classroom rules, the student has the option to either follow or not follow them.

Comply suggests a voluntary action, while submit suggests an obligatory action.

Concede.wordDefinition:
Concede means to admit that something is true or correct, even if you did not want to.

It can also mean to admit defeat in a competition or argument. For example, "After arguing for hours, John conceded that Mary was right.".

Concede involves admitting something is true, while submit involves giving in to someone or something with more power.

Concede is used more in the context of arguments, while submit is used more in the context of authority or submitting something for approval.

Conform.wordDefinition:
Conform means to adhere to or follow a set of rules, standards, or expectations. This is often done voluntarily as a way to fit in or be accepted by a group or society.

In simpler terms, conforming is more of a personal choice to fit in, while submitting is often done out of a sense of obligation or pressure.

Conforming may be applicable in social settings or workplaces where certain behaviors or dress codes are expected, while submitting may be applicable in situations such as obeying laws or following orders in a hierarchy.

Consent.wordDefinition:
Consent means giving permission or agreeing to something. It is applicable in situations where someone needs to agree to an action or decision that affects them.

For example, a patient may need to give their consent before undergoing surgery.

Consent refers to giving permission or agreeing to something, while submit refers to complying with rules or regulations.

Relinquish.wordDefinition:
Relinquish means to voluntarily give up or let go of something or someone. It often carries a sense of giving up control or ownership.

For example, a person might relinquish their claim to a property or relinquish their position of power.

Relinquish is more about giving up control, while submit is more about giving in to a higher power or authority.

Succumb.wordDefinition:
Submit means to give in or agree to something willingly or unwillingly, whereas succumb means to give in or give up completely because of pressure or persuasion, often in a negative sense.

Submitting is a choice, while succumbing is often seen as a negative or weaker action. Submitting is applicable in situations where you willingly agree to something or someone, while succumbing is more applicable in situations where you are overwhelmed or defeated by something or someone.

Surrender.wordDefinition:
Surrender means to give up or relinquish control or possession of something. It often implies defeat or yielding to a stronger force.

For example, a soldier might surrender to an enemy army or a criminal might surrender to the police.

Submit is more neutral and can be used in a variety of situations, while surrender usually connotes a more significant sense of loss or defeat.

Yield.wordDefinition:
Both submit and yield mean to give in or surrender in some way, but they are used in slightly different situations.

Yield usually means to give up or surrender to something more powerful or inevitable, like a yield sign telling you to give priority to other drivers.

For example, you might yield to the demands of someone in authority, like a boss or a coach.

Submit is more often used in formal contexts (like submitting a form), while yield is used in both formal and everyday communication (like yielding to another driver on the road).

quotes.Text: I thought a director was like a pillow who sat under the writer, supporting them and submitting to their vision. It took me a long time to realise that what a writer really wants is a production that matches the play and the writing. It is the only way the play can achieve its full potential.
quotes.Title: English Director
quotes.Name: John Tiffany

quotes.Text: I surrender to my directors. I do that because I respect them immensely. In fact, a director's talent scares me. I admit that they're more intelligent than me, and I submit to that, as an assistant director does. Even when I have suggestions to make, I don't state them strongly.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Vijay Sethupathi

quotes.Text: I just submitted what I had to the 'Octopus Books' contest open reading period, and they said they wanted to publish my poetry book. Then I started to publish more and more poetry because people would ask me to do readings or ask me submit something for their journal.
quotes.Title: Chinese Actress
quotes.Name: Jenny Zhang

quotes.Text: With regard to moral rules, the child submits more or less completely in intention to the rules laid down for him, but these, remaining, as it were, external to the subject's conscience, do not really transform his conduct.
quotes.Title: Swiss Psychologist
quotes.Name: Jean Piaget

quotes.Text: I was always ready to submit my life to my career - but I don't think anything could have truly prepared me for the reality of that.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: Jinkx Monsoon

quotes.Text: I have made mistakes, but I didn't make them again. Even when I struggled, I promised myself never to submit in life.
quotes.Name: Jan Blachowicz

quotes.Text: It gives a different kind of high when, as an actor, I get to submit myself to the character I play.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Vidya Balan

quotes.Text: The truth is, if we don't learn to submit to authority, we won't ever learn to submit to God.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.Text: I'm a two-time world champion in jiu-jitsu. I can try to submit you.
quotes.Title: Brazilian Athlete
quotes.Name: Cris Cyborg

quotes.Text: It is one thing to praise discipline, and another to submit to it.
quotes.Title: Spanish Novelist
quotes.Name: Miguel de Cervantes
